source_sentence: 尊者大迦多演那，於第七日於此城中見雨塵土，知是業力不可救濟，即與勝音城中舊住天女，并侍者童子，見土滿城人無遺子，乘空而去至大聚落，止穀場中暫時停息，整理衣鉢入村乞食。
translation: On the seventh day, when Venerable Mahākātyāyana saw rain and dust in this city, he knew that it was because of the power of his karma that he couldn't be saved, so he went with the goddess who used to live in Vaiśravaṇa's city and her attendant boy, saw that the dust filled the city without any remaining children, flew into the sky and departed for a large

source_sentence: 由天力故場中稻穀自然盈滿，是時場主見斯事已，作如是語：『我此場中稻穀盈溢，皆由天女威神之力。』
translation: Because of the god's power, the rice and grains in the field are naturally full, and when the host of the hall saw this, he said, 'This is because of the authoritative power of the goddess.'

source_sentence: 即持戶鑰授與天女，報言：『乃至我未重來，請勿棄去。』
translation: He then handed the door key to the goddess and replied, 'Even if I don't come back, throw it away.'

source_sentence: 便往村中眾人集處普告之曰：『於我場中有天女至，由彼威力場穀增多，君等若能共立我兒為聚落主者，我當留彼天女以相擁護常受安樂。』
translation: He then went to the village where the people assembled and told them, 'There's a goddess at my place who arrived, and because the grain grows in that mighty field, if you can make my child the leader of the village together, I will leave that goddess behind to embrace her and always experience peace and happiness.'

source_sentence: 諸人聞已咸云：『善好！』
translation: After the people heard it, they all said, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 即立彼兒為聚落主，其父即向屏處，便以利刀自刎而死。
translation: He then made that child the village head, and his father went to a secluded place, killed himself with a sharp sword, and died.

source_sentence: 「時迦多演那乞得食已，還至場中共伴分食，食了收衣鉢，告彼天女曰：『我欲前行，汝被他囑不可隨去。』
translation: After he had begged for food, Kātyāyana returned to the monastery, shared his meal with his companions, ate it, collected his robe and bowl, and told the goddess, 'I want to go ahead; you're instructed by someone else not to follow me.'

source_sentence: 天女曰：『我有何事不得隨行？』
translation: The goddess said, 'What's the matter with me that I can't follow?'

source_sentence: 尊者告曰：『受他戶鑰，其主未來，若捨去者是傷信義。』
translation: The venerable told him, 'Anyone who receives the key to another's door will be harmed by that person's faith if they abandon it in the future.'

source_sentence: 須臾之頃村邑諸人各持香花來申供養，請天女曰：『我等有福幸聖來儀，伏願慈悲留神此住，隨所須者我皆供給。』
translation: In a moment, the people of the villages and towns each brought incense and flowers to make offerings, inviting the goddesses, 'We're blessed by the noble arrival, so may we remain here with kindness and compassion, and whatever we need, we'll provide for it.'

source_sentence: 天女報曰：『若其君等苦相留者，可為大德迦多演那造立寺宇，并可為我別立神廟，四事供養無闕乏者，我當住此。』
translation: The goddesses replied, 'If you gentlemen are staying here in painful places, build a temple for the great virtuous Kātyāyana and establish a separate shrine for me with four kinds of offerings that aren't lacking, I will stay here.'

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：『此皆為作。』
translation: The people replied, 'All of these are done for me.'

source_sentence: 即便造寺，去斯不遠為立神堂，供養無闕。
translation: So they built a monastery not far from the stupa to house the relics and erected a deva hall for their worship. The relics were offered without fail.

source_sentence: 時彼天女每於夜半秉持燈炬，就尊者所聽聞妙法，村人見者便作譏議：『云何神女夜詣苾芻共行非法？』
translation: Every time at midnight, that goddess held a torch of the lamp in her hand and listened to the wonderful teaching from the Bhagavān as he heard it.

source_sentence: 神女聞已遂起瞋心，呪彼村人皆令疾患，諸人知已咸就神所共申懺謝，患苦遂除。
translation: When the goddesses heard this, they became angry and cursed the villagers so that they would all become ill. Knowing this, the people went to the goddesses to express their repentance together, and their suffering was then removed.

source_sentence: 尊者知已即辭神女，留小銅盞以為記念，便令紺顏童子執法衣角，騰空而去。
translation: Knowing this, the venerable one immediately departed. The goddess withdrew and left behind a small bronze tortoise shell in memory of him. He then caused the youthful violet-colored boy to take off the horns of his religious robe, rose up into the air, and departed.

source_sentence: 是時神女遂勸村人造窣堵波，盞置於內名為銅盞制底，今猶現在。
translation: The goddess then encouraged the villagers to build a stupa, and the shell placed inside it was called the copper shell caitya, which is still in existence.

source_sentence: 時紺顏童子執師衣角懸身而去，時人遙見皆悉唱言：『濫波底、濫波底(是懸挂義)』其所經過方國之處因號濫波(今北印度現有其國)。
translation: The dark- complexed boy then took the horns of his teacher's robe, hung it over his body, and departed. When people saw him from a distance, they all called out, 'Māraṇḍapālī and Māraṇḍapālī (which means hanging upright).' The place where he passed by was called Māraṇḍapālī (the presently existing state in North India).

source_sentence: 「尊者漸去至一小國，其王命終絕無繼嗣。
translation: “The venerable monk gradually departed and arrived at a small kingdom, where his life ended and there was no successor.

source_sentence: 時彼諸人皆知尊者神德高遠，遂請童子立為君主。
translation: Knowing that the venerable's spiritual virtue was so lofty, those people then invited the boy to establish him as their ruler.

source_sentence: 尊者許之，遂便策為紺顏王留知國務，從此復往步迦拏國。
translation: The Venerable allowed him to do so, and then he became the king of Kaḷārakaṇḍa and remained in charge of state affairs. From here he proceeded again to the country of Kāṭikāṭika.

source_sentence: 尊者之母生此國中，名賢善童女，尊者就舍為其說法，令得見諦。
translation: The Venerable's mother was born in this country, named Bhadrapāla, and the Venerable preached the Dharma to her in a monastic dwelling so that she would attain insight.

source_sentence: 授之錫杖與作記念，彼造錫杖制底現今供養。
translation: He gave him a tin cane to make a memory of it, and he made a tin cane for the restraints that are presently offered as an offering.

source_sentence: 尊者從此欲往中國路過雪嶺，北方諸天俱來請曰：『唯願慈哀於我住處為留少許記念之事。』
translation: From here, the venerable wanted to go to China and pass through the snowy mountains, and the gods of the north came and asked, 'Please have mercy and pity on me where I live so that I can leave a little bit of memory.'

source_sentence: 尊者便念：『如世尊說：「中方之地不著布羅。」』
translation: The venerable then thought, 'Suppose the Bhagavān says, The ground on the side doesn't touch the bowl.'

source_sentence: 即便以屨付與天神。
translation: He then gave it to the gods and goddesses with his robe.

source_sentence: 諸神得已於爽塏之地造一制底，名曰布羅制底。

source_sentence: 是時尊者過縛叉河至布灑城內，巡家乞食。

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻尋問所由，尊者具答其事。
translation: The monks then asked what the reason was, and the venerable answered in detail.

source_sentence: 苾芻聞已作如是語：「彼殺父人生極邪見，且受如是現世花報，未來苦果誰復代當？」
translation: After hearing this, the monk said, That person killed their father and gave birth to someone with a very wrong view, and they'll experience such flowers in the present life as retribution, so who will be his replacement for future painful results?

source_sentence: 時迦多演那洗手足已，往詣佛所頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: Kātyāyana then washed his hands and feet, went to the Buddha, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知而故問：「迦多演那！
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān then asked, Kātyāyana!

source_sentence: 汝所遊履得安樂不？」
translation: Will you be comfortable in your travels?

source_sentence: 時迦多演那以所經事具白世尊，世尊聞已默然而住。
translation: Kātyāyana then told the Bhagavān what he had taught, and the Bhagavān remained silent after hearing it.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻聞其說已，咸皆有疑，白佛言：「世尊唯願慈悲為我宣說。
translation: When the monks heard what he taught, they all had doubts and said to the Buddha, Bhagavān, please have mercy and compassion and explain it for me.

source_sentence: 彼仙道苾芻以何緣故，身為國主受大快樂，捨此勝位歸佛出家，斷諸煩惱得阿羅漢，不免刀殺？」
translation: For what reason did that monk of the sage's path become a king and experience great happiness, abandon this superior position, return to the Buddha, leave home, cut off all afflictions, become an arhat, and not escape being killed by a sword?

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「汝等當聽！

translation: The actions created by the monks of the sage path must be experienced for themselves when causes and conditions ripen, and there's no place to run away, as explained above.

translation: At the time, there was a hunter who stored a large amount of deer at this place and often caught many deer. Suddenly he found nothing to eat.

source_sentence: 聖者哀愍為昇空界，獵人求下，聖者因即命終，遂火焚屍灌八牛乳，收其餘骨為造制底，種種供養頂禮悲哀。
translation: The holy man's grief is that he ascended to the realm of space, and the hunter seeks to go down there. When the holy man dies, he burns his corpse in a fire and pours milk into eight cow dung, collects the remaining bones for the base of his body, makes various kinds of offerings, pays homage, and venerates him with sorrow.

source_sentence: 『願勿因此受三塗報，所有供養功德生大王家，貲財豐足，當獲如是功德希奇，勝此大師承事供養心無厭倦。』
translation: 'May you not receive the retribution of the three destinies because of this, be born in a great king's family with all the merits of offerings and wealth, and attain such extraordinary merits that you won't tire of serving and making offerings to this great teacher.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！

translation: The hunter in the past was a monk named Sengdao, because in the past he used an arrow to shoot at the honored pratyekabuddha and suffered the pain of hell for many lifetimes, and then he was always killed by a sword or arrow for 500 lifetimes as a human being.

translation: It's because of the power of my past vows that I met and became an arhat, and it's still because I didn't escape being harmed by a sword or sword that I entered nirvāṇa.

translation: What are the reasons why the prince's topknot and the surpassing sound city men and women of Kātyāyana were crushed by dust, benefited, rid themselves of their afflictions, and left the city with the treasure?

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「此等諸人因緣運會業果現前，廣說如上，乃至果報還自受。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, These people's causes and conditions will cause the results of their actions to be manifested, as explained above, up to the point where the results will be experienced by themselves.

source_sentence: 汝等當聽！
translation: You should listen!

source_sentence: 於過去世一聚落中有長者住，娶妻未久誕生一息次生一女，各漸長大。
translation: In a past life, there was an elderly man living in a village. Before he had married his wife for a long time, he gave birth to one daughter after another and each gradually grew up into a woman.

source_sentence: 男既娶妻，女未成嫁，諸餘女伴皆作婚姻，斯之一女絕無人問。
translation: When a man takes a wife and a woman doesn't get married, the other women who are companions will all marry, and this one woman won't ask questions.

translation: At the time, there was a solitary realizer honored one who appeared in the world, explaining it as before.

translation: There was a solitary realizer who traveled among the people, arriving in this village to enter the village to solicit alms.

translation: Seeing the noble one coming, the young daughter of Nandika then swept off her body with dung. On that day someone asked her relatives.

source_sentence: 其兄怪問：『何故今朝有人問汝？』
translation: The brother wondered, 'Why is someone asking you questions this morning?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我於向者以惡糞掃棄苾芻上。』
translation: He answered, 'I'll sweep the monk up with bad dung from the donor.'

source_sentence: 兄聞而笑，女便以事告諸同伴，諸女聞已咸希嫁娶，競以糞掃投擲苾芻。
translation: When the brother heard this, he laughed, and the woman then told her companions about it. After hearing it, all the women wanted to marry him, and they competed to throw dung into the monk.

source_sentence: 如是展轉盡大聚落所有人民，並皆邪見將此為善。
translation: Thus, all the people in a large village are bound to have wrong views that regard this as good.

source_sentence: 時彼聖者恐罪眾人，遂便捨去。
translation: Fearing that the sage would offend the people, he then abandoned them.

source_sentence: 復有五通仙者來至此處，諸人復以糞掃而棄擲之，仙見此已亦復捨去。
translation: When another sage of the five supernormal powers came to this place, the people again swept it down with dung and threw it away.

source_sentence: 人皆生念：『於尊者所棄糞得福。』
translation: People all had the thought, 'That's good fortune when you discard the excrement of the venerable.'

source_sentence: 遂於父母之上亦棄糞穢。
translation: He then also discarded the dung and filth above his parents.

source_sentence: 時此聚落有二長者，見行非法普告之曰：『仁等所作實乖法憲，緣斯惡業必招苦果。』
translation: At the time, there were two elders in this village who saw that what they did was unlawful and universally told them, 'You people, what you did really disobeyed the rules of the Dharma, and because of this bad action, it would surely bring painful results.'

source_sentence: 聚落諸人雖聞此語，而邪見轉增惡心不息。
translation: Even though the people in the village heard these words, their wrong views increased and bad thoughts didn't stop.

source_sentence: 「汝等苾芻！

source_sentence: 時彼二長者諫止諸人者，即利益、除患二大臣是，往時勸止不令邪見，今時免難不被塵壓。
translation: Those two elders then remonstrated with the people, which are the two ministers of benefit and freedom from affliction, who were formerly encouraged to stop wrong views and aren't allowed to be freed from their difficulties now that they won't be crushed by the dust.

translation: When the boy's brother saw that he was laughing, he said, That's Kātyāyana, and because he was laughing in the past, he was still pressed by the earth.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！

translation: If Kātyāyana didn't realize the fruit of post-learning, his life would surely end now because he crushed the land.

source_sentence: 是故諸苾芻！

translation: If pure black karma attains pure black retribution, it's explained in detail as above, even up to the point where it should be cultivated.

translation: It was then that there was an elder named Sun Cai in the city of Kauśinagara, whose words sounded like gold and his family had a hundred million coins.

translation: You may get up and work on the task of producing.

translation: When this elder's house was near the king's palace, people heard the sound of his words and thought, This man's sounds unified into one hundred million coins until morning to gather them.

translation: The king then summoned his ministers and said, This wealthy man of good fortune, when I heard his voice, relied on the Dharma according to its characteristics for a hundred million pieces of money.

translation: The ministers heard this and knew that the king had marveled at his good appearance like never before.

source_sentence: 由王知彼有妙音響，時人因即喚為妙音長者。
translation: Because the king knew that they had a wonderful sound, the people then called out to the elder Sublime Sound.

source_sentence: 由彼長者乃至失命因緣，終不口中故為妄語，王見驚嗟立為國相，長者以法輔正映蔽，諸臣悉皆見嫉，遂白王曰：「妙音大臣多行欺誑。」
translation: Because of the causes and conditions for that elder's death, he never spoke false words in his mouth. translation: After hearing this, the king tested it and lent half a hundred million pieces of money so that they could be collected at any place where the people wished.

translation: The elder then took it according to the number and didn't lose a penny.

source_sentence: 王勘知已深生希有，重加其位。
translation: Knowing this, the king gave rise to a deep feeling of wonder and reinforced his position.

source_sentence: 時妙音大臣體知財食皆悉無常，遂造義堂給施衣食，令人守掌，告其人曰：「若見有人容儀別者，當須告我。」
translation: Knowing that their possessions and food were all impermanent, the minister Marvelous Sound then built an alms hall to give them clothing and food, made them guard their palms, and told them, If you see someone with a different appearance, you must tell me.

source_sentence: 是時南方有五百隱逸遁俗之賓，故弊充衣少欲為務，遠涉艱險欲向憍閃毘國，於其中路無水可求，即便共詣一大樹下，告言：「可與我水。」
translation: At the time, there were five hundred hermits and secular guests in the south who had few desires to serve because their robes were so poorly decorated that they wanted to go to the country of Kauśinagara but didn't have water to ask for. They went together to a large tree and told them, Give me some water.

source_sentence: 時樹枝間忽展一手，環釧莊嚴持瓶注水，彼五百人皆飽足飲已，問言：「汝是何神？」
translation: Suddenly, one hand spreads out between the branches of the tree, rings it with a necklace and adornment, holds a pot and pours water, and those five hundred people who have had enough to drink ask, What god are you?

source_sentence: 答曰：「我於前身去給孤獨長者家不遠而住，為客縫衣人。
translation: He answered, In my previous life, I was staying at the house of an orphaned elderly man not far from him as a guest seamstress.

source_sentence: 諸有貧乏不知長者居宅處者，我即以手指示其處。
translation: If there were poor people who didn't know where the elder lived, I would point out their place with my hand.

source_sentence: 復由受持八支戒故，今得生此屬四大王眾天。」
translation: It's also because they observe the eight precepts that they can now be born here among the four great kings and gods.

source_sentence: 時五百人見斯事已更相告曰：「由持戒故報得生天，我等亦應詣給孤獨長者處，受褒灑陀八支淨戒。」
translation: Seeing this, the five hundred people then told each other, Because they observed the precepts, they were rewarded with birth in heaven, so we should also go to the place of the orphaned elder and receive the eight pure precepts of the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 彼行漸次至妙音長者所設義堂，受供養已，掌人還舍白長者曰：「有五百人，云從南國，形儀殊俗，可喚問之。」
translation: Gradually, he went to the hall of meaning set up by the elder Miaoyin and made offerings to it. After accepting the offerings, the palmer returned to Sāvatthī and said to the elder, There are five hundred people who say they're from the southern kingdom; their appearance is so extraordinary that they can be summoned to ask questions.

source_sentence: 長者命人問曰：「仁等從何所來？」
translation: The elder summoned someone and asked, Where are you coming from?

source_sentence: 答曰：「我等從南方來。」
translation: He replied, We came from the south.

source_sentence: 又問：「今欲何之？」
translation: Again, he asked, What do you want now?

source_sentence: 答曰：「欲往室羅伐城給孤獨長者處，受八支戒。」
translation: He answered, I want to go to the city of Śrāvastī and give it to an orphaned elder who receives the eight precepts.

source_sentence: 妙音告曰：「仁等可於此住待三月夏終，我當共去。」
translation: Miaoyin told him, Sir, you may stay here for three months until the end of summer; I'll go with you.

source_sentence: 答曰：「如是。」
translation: He replied, So it is.

source_sentence: 至夏終已，妙音長者與五百人至給孤獨長者處，慰問訖具陳其事。
translation: When the summer came to an end, the elder Miaoyin and five hundred others went to the place where the orphaned elder was staying, greeted him, and told him all about his affairs.

source_sentence: 時彼長者將此諸人往詣佛所，俱禮佛足在一面坐。
translation: The elder then led these people to the Buddha, bowed their heads at his feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊觀彼根性，隨機說法令出家已，斷諸煩惱證阿羅漢果，妙音長者得預流果。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān observed their faculties, explained the teachings appropriately, and ordered them to leave home, cut off afflictions, realize the fruit of arhatship, and the elder Miaoyin to attain the fruit of stream-winner.

source_sentence: 既見諦已頂禮佛足，白言：「世尊！
translation: Having seen the truth, he bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯願哀愍往憍閃毘，我當為佛及諸聖眾造毘訶羅。」
translation: Please have mercy on me and go to Kauśinagara, for whom I will create Vaiśravaṇa for the sake of the Buddha and the sages.

source_sentence: 世尊默然慈悲受請，即告大准陀曰：「汝今可共妙音長者，往憍閃毘造毘訶羅。」
translation: The Bhagavān accepted the invitation with silent compassion and then addressed Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, Now, you may go to Kauśinagara and create a vihāra together with the elder Miaoyin.

source_sentence: 時大准陀受佛教已，執持衣鉢共妙音俱行至憍閃毘，造一住處修營既了，遣使白佛：「造寺事周，唯願世尊及苾芻眾慈悲降赴。」
translation: After he had received the Buddha's teaching, Mahāprajñāpāramitā took his robe and bowl, traveled to Kauśinagara together with Marvelous Sound, built a dwelling place, and finished cultivating it, sent an envoy to tell the Buddha, The construction of the temple is complete, so please let the Bhagavān and the monks have mercy and compassion when they descend.

source_sentence: 世尊於日初分飯食訖，執持衣鉢將諸大眾，往憍閃毘至妙音園，於寺外池所洗手灌足方入寺中。
translation: When the World-honored One had finished his meal on the first watch of the day, he took his robes and almsbowl, led the assembly of monks, and entered the monastery by going to the garden of Vaiśravaṇa’s abode. After washing his hands and feet in the pond outside the monastery, he entered the monastery.

source_sentence: 時妙音長者即以金瓶注水，佛為受之。
translation: The elder Sumeru then poured water into a gold vase and the Buddha accepted it for him.

source_sentence: 請佛及僧受斯住處，既至明日長者盛設供養，供佛及僧。
translation: He invited the Buddha and the saṃgha to accept this dwelling place, and when he arrived tomorrow, the elder made a great offering to the Buddha and the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 飯食訖洗鉢器嚼齒木澡漱已，大准陀及妙音長者并諸眷屬，頂禮佛足在一面坐，為聽法故准陀白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After he had finished his meal, he washed his bowl, chewed his teeth and wood, and rinsed it. Then Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, the householder Miaoying, and his retinues bowed their heads at the Buddha’s feet and sat to one side. Because they were listening to the Dharma, Cunda said to the Buddha:

source_sentence: 願為我等開示演說，作何福業獲大果利，光顯無窮福常增長相續不絕？」
translation: May you reveal and explain for us what meritorious deeds you've done to attain great rewards, which clearly show that infinite merit always grows and continues without cease?

source_sentence: 佛告准陀：「有其七種有事福業、無事福業，我為汝說，當一心聽！
translation: The Buddha told Cunda, There are seven kinds of meritorious and meritless actions that I'll explain for you, so listen with one mind!

source_sentence: 若有淨信善男子善女人，成就如是七福業者，若行住坐臥若睡若覺，於一切時如是福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: If there are pure faithful good men and good women who accomplish these seven kinds of meritorious actions, whether walking, standing, sitting, lying, sleeping, or awakening, such meritorious actions at all times will attain great rewards, a ray of light that's limitless in its fruition, and the constant growth of merit that doesn't stop.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 准陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有善男子善女人，以好園圃施四方僧。
translation: Suppose there are good men and good women who give a nice garden or pond to the saṃgha in four directions.

source_sentence: 此是第一有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，由此福故，若行住坐臥若睡若覺，於一切時如是福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the first meritorious action of service that obtains a great fruit and produces an infinite ray of light. Because of this merit, when one walks, stands, sits, lies down, sleeps, or awakens, at all times such meritorious action obtains a great fruit and produces an infinite ray of light, and merit always increases continuously without cease.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於此園中造立寺舍施四方僧。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, build a temple in this park and give it to the saṃgha of the four directions.

source_sentence: 此是第二有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the second kind of meritorious action that produces great rewards and benefits in terms of deeds, which are manifested without limit. Merit always increases and continues to do so without cease.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於此寺中施以種種床座被褥沙門資具。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, they'll give various kinds of beds, seats, bedding, and other ascetic necessities at this temple.

source_sentence: 此是第三有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the third kind of meritorious deed that produces great rewards and benefits, which are manifested without limit in terms of their luminosity. Merit always increases and continues to do so without cease.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於此寺中常施美妙隨時飲食供養眾僧。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, they'll always give delicious food and drink at any time in this temple to support the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 此是第四有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the fourth deed of merit that produces great rewards and benefits, which are manifested without limit. Merit always increases and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於新來客苾芻及將欲行者供給供養。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, they'll make offerings to newly arrived monks and those who are about to travel.

source_sentence: 此是第五有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the fifth meritorious deed that produces great rewards and benefits, which are manifested without limit. Merit always increases and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀若有淨信男子女人，於病者處及看病人供給供養。
translation: Furthermore, if there are purely believing men and women in Cunda, they'll make offerings to the sick person's place and nursing him or her.

source_sentence: 此是第六有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the sixth deed of merit that produces great rewards and benefits, which are manifested without limit. Merit always increases and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於風寒雨雪炎熱之時，便以種種隨時飲食乃至麨粥，持至寺內供養眾僧，令無辛苦食已安住。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, then when it's cold, rainy, snowy, and hot, they take various kinds of food and drink or even porridge to the monastery to make offerings to the saṃgha so that they won't have to endure painful food and can live peacefully.

source_sentence: 此是第七有事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the seventh deed of merit that produces great rewards and benefits, which are manifested without limit. Merit always increases and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 准陀當知！
translation: Cunda, you should know!

source_sentence: 此之七種有事福業，若有男子女人要期結願相續作者，此之福量不可數知。
translation: These seven kinds of meritorious actions that are contingent on the fact that if a man or woman wants to form a vow for a period of time and continues to do so, the amount of merit will be incalculable.

source_sentence: 得爾所福獲如是果，感得如是勝妙之身，但可名為是大福聚。
translation: Attaining such-and-such merit and obtaining such-and-such fruit, which brings such-and-such a wonderful body, can only be called a great stock of merit.

source_sentence: 准陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 如五大河和合一處，同流而去趣於大海，其名曰：弶伽河、琰母河、薩羅喻河、阿市羅伐底河、莫熙河。
translation: Suppose the five great rivers are combined into one place, flowing together and going to the ocean. Their names are Ganges River, Yangmu River,sarayue River, Aciravatī River, and Mohi River.

source_sentence: 此之水量不可得知，有若干斛百千萬億，不能數知，但可名為是大水聚。」
translation: The amount of this water can't be known, and there are several hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of gallons of water that can't be counted; it can only be called a great mass of water.

source_sentence: 爾時准陀復白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that Cunda again said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我等已聞有事福業，無事福業願更為說。」
translation: We've heard that there's meritorious action and no meritorious action, so we'd like to explain it again.

source_sentence: 佛告准陀：「當知有七無事福業。
translation: The Buddha told Cunda, You should know that there are seven kinds of meritless actions.

source_sentence: 若有男子女人成就如是七福業者，若行住坐臥若睡若覺，於一切時如是福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: If a man or woman accomplishes these seven meritorious actions, whether walking, standing, sitting, lying, sleeping, or awakening, and at all times performs such meritorious actions, they'll attain great rewards, benefit, radiance, and manifestation without limit, and their merit will always grow and continue without cease.

source_sentence: 云何為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 准陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信善男子善女人，聞有如來若如來弟子，於某村坊依止而住，聞已歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely faithful good men and good women who hear that there's a Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata living in a certain village or monastery, they rejoice when they hear it and become free from it.

source_sentence: 此是第一無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮。
translation: This is the first kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and illuminates without limit.

source_sentence: 由此福故若行住坐臥若睡若覺，於一切時如是福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: Because of this merit, whether he walks, stands, sits, lies, sleeps, or awakens, such meritorious actions at all times obtain great rewards and benefits that are manifested without limit, and merit always grows in continuity without cease.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，聞彼如來若如來弟子欲來至此，聞已歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women who hear that the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata wants to come here, they'll rejoice when they hear it and become liberated.

source_sentence: 此是第二無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the second kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，聞彼如來若如來弟子涉路而來，聞已歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women who hear that the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata is coming along the path, they'll be delighted to hear it and give rise to the mind of leaving.

source_sentence: 此是第三無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the third kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，聞彼如來若如來弟子至某村坊，聞已歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women who hear that the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata go to a certain village, they rejoice when they hear it and give rise to the mind of emancipation.

source_sentence: 此是第四無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the fourth kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，詣彼如來若如來弟子處欲申敬禮，見已歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women who go to the place where the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata wants to venerate them, they'll rejoice when they see them and become liberated.

source_sentence: 此是第五無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the fifth kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，見彼如來若如來弟子，便即一心聽受妙法，既聞法已發大歡喜生出離心。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women who see the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata, they'll whole-heartedly hear and accept the wonderful teaching, and after hearing it, they'll become very joyful and give rise to the mind of liberation.

source_sentence: 此是第六無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the sixth kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 復次准陀！
translation: Furthermore, Cunda!

source_sentence: 若有淨信男子女人，於彼如來若如來弟子，既聞法已歸佛法僧受持淨戒。
translation: If there are purely believing men and women, then the Tathāgata or a disciple of the Tathāgata will return to the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha after hearing the teaching and observe the pure precepts.

source_sentence: 此是第七無事福業，獲大果利光顯無窮，福常增長相續不絕。
translation: This is the seventh kind of meritless action that obtains great rewards and benefits, revealing their light without limit. Merit always grows and continues unceasingly.

source_sentence: 准陀當知！
translation: Cunda, you should know!

source_sentence: 此之七種無事福業，若有男子女人要期結願相續作者，此之福量不可數知，得爾所福獲如是果，感得如是勝妙之身，但可名為是大福聚。
translation: These seven kinds of meritorious actions that are devoid of anything, such as if a man or woman wants to form a vow for a period of time and continues to perform it, the amount of merit they attain is incalculable, and when they attain such merit and obtain such results, they'll attain such a marvelous body, which can only be called a great stock of merit.

source_sentence: 准陀！
translation: Cunda!

source_sentence: 如五大河和合一處，同流而去趣於大海，其名曰：弶伽河、琰母河、薩羅喻河、阿市羅伐底河、莫熙河。
translation: Suppose the five great rivers are combined into one place, flowing together and going to the ocean. Their names are Ganges River, Yangmu River,sarayue River, Aciravatī River, and Mohi River.

source_sentence: 此之水量不可得知，有若干斛百千萬億，不能數知，但可名為是大水聚。」
translation: The amount of this water can't be known, and there are several hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of gallons of water that can't be counted; it can only be called a great mass of water.

source_sentence: 「五河清潔淨諸物，　　妙津孕寶導眾流；
translation: Five rivers clean and pure things, Sublime rivers carry treasures to guide the flow of all streams.

source_sentence: 能令人獸等歸依，　　各競奔注無停息。
translation: They can cause animals and so forth to take refuge, Each rushing and galloping without stopping.

source_sentence: 若人能修有事福，　　及無事福生歡喜；
translation: If people can cultivate meritorious virtues, And also merits that are not meritorious, They will become joyous.

source_sentence: 勝福常流歸此人，　　如眾河水投溟海。」
translation: The eternal stream of superior merit always flows to this person, like the water in many rivers that plunge into the ocean.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說是法已說伽他曰：爾時大准陀及妙音長者，人天大眾，聞佛所說各生希有，頂禮佛足歡喜奉行。
translation: After the Bhagavān had explained this teaching, he taught it to the Gatha, saying, At that point, the great Cunda and the elder Miaoyin, the great multitude of humans and gods who heard what the Buddha taught, each became rare, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, rejoiced, and carried it out.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻咸皆有疑，請世尊曰：「大德！
translation: The monks then all had doubts and asked the Bhagavān, Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 此妙音長者曾作何業，大王聞聲表知其事，因號妙音？」
translation: What was the action of this elder Sumeru that the great king heard the sound and knew what he did, so he called himself Sumeru?

source_sentence: 佛告諸苾芻：「乃往過去婆羅痆斯城，於十二年中天旱無雨。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, In the past, he went to the city of Vārāṇasī, where there was a drought and no rain for twelve years.

source_sentence: 有一長者名曰善合，處分一人為掌庫者常出賜物，於日日中以上妙飲食供養一千獨覺聖者。
translation: There was an elder named Suneong, who had one man named Shanhe as the treasurer of the treasury and always gave things to him, offering food and drink for 1,000 solitary realizers and sages day after day.

source_sentence: 其營食人每旦恒將一狗往白時至，忽於別日忘不白知，其狗看日欲午，即走向千聖處謳謳作聲。
translation: Every day at dawn, the food preparation man always took a dog and went to the place where the time came. On another day he suddenly forgot what he had not told him. The dog was observing the sun when it was about to go toward noon. So he went to one of the thousand holy spots to make a noise in music.

source_sentence: 時諸聖者見狗聲別，知是來請，即俱往長者舍，其狗又往白時至人處作聲，彼人見已作如是念：『豈非此狗命聖者來。』
translation: Seeing the dog's voice distinct, the sages knew that it was coming to invite them, so they both went to the elder's house and the dog went to the place where the man was staying.

source_sentence: 遂即如常供養諸聖。
translation: He then made offerings to the sages as usual.

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 如是應知！
translation: So it should be known!

source_sentence: 往時善合長者，即我身是。
translation: In the past, that good-gathering elder was me.

source_sentence: 掌庫人者即給孤獨是。
translation: The person in charge of the treasury is Anāthapiṇḍika.

source_sentence: 白時至者即烏陀演那王是。
translation: When he arrived, he said, 'This is King Udayana.'

source_sentence: 狗者即妙音是。
translation: The dog is the marvelous sound.

source_sentence: 由彼往聲白聖者故，今得好音。
translation: Because their past voice was white to the noble one, they now attain a good voice.

source_sentence: 如是皆由先世因緣今受其報。」
translation: It's all because of the causes and conditions of a prior life that they'll now receive their reward.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻歡喜信受。
translation: The monks then rejoiced and believed it.

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶卷第四十六
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya, vol. 46
